newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador economy minister forecasts 4.0 pct growth.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador economy minister forecasts 4.0 pct growth.

text.p: Ecuador's gross domestic product will grow by 4.0 percent next year, Finance Minister Pablo Concha said Thursday.

The minister forecast inflation will be 25 percent this year and 20 percent in 1997. In September, Ecuador's consumer prices rose 2.38 percent, bringing the inflation rate in the first nine months of the year to an accumulated 19.4 percent.
"Inflation will not be fought through monetary policy but with higher production. So 1997 will be a year of recovery," Concha told reporters.
Prior to the minister's statements, the government had predicted that inflation would stand at between 23 percent and 24 percent at the end of this year.
Concha made no mention of a previous official forecast of 2.9 percent growth for this year.
